history.review_excerpt:
It takes some learning to get things mastered but we were all immediately able to create little boxes to stick people. And from there, the options are as endless as your imagination, patience, and supply of color sticks can manage.

We have used another chemical set, the ido3d set, that is like this but hardened in UV light, and this is heads and shoulders better. The pen is a little unwieldy, but not bad.

I mention above that patience is important, it does take a while to draw. The refills don't look cheap although there appear to be some generic media out there for cheaper. This set comes with quite a bit of filaments, but expect to need more quickly
history.review_full:
This is an amazing creativity tool. It takes some learning to get things mastered but we were all immediately able to create little boxes to stick people. And from there, the options are as endless as your imagination, patience, and supply of color sticks can manage.

We have used another chemical set, the ido3d set, that is like this but hardened in UV light, and this is heads and shoulders better. The action is kind of like a hot glue gun except that the sticks dry very quickly and are dry instantly unlike the other set. The pen is a little unwieldy, but not bad.

I mention above that patience is important, it does take a while to draw. And it is hard to get drafting crisp straight lines. Be loose and have fun.

My biggest concern was refills. And it still is. The refills don't look cheap although there appear to be some generic media out there for cheaper. That's probably what I'll end up going with when we run very low. This set comes with quite a bit of filaments, but expect to need more quickly

I like these because they tent away from my mouth a bit and give room to breath and speak. Also they are comfortable round ears. They could be more protective, but they could not be any more comfortable and still be protective.

history.review_excerpt:
I figured something like this for my 5 year old would be good and less chaotic in terms of crashing/smashing cymbals.

The sound quality is great and we’ve connected to both a Bluetooth speaker and a wired headset (separately). The speaker is way more entertaining.

The record feature may be better served for if my son (or sons) get better but it does also help when it comes to a battle of who played it best between the two.

The different settings are more than we need but a great feature. We did put this on an old school desk which works perfect for the setup (a desk with a fully removable seat).

Very happy we got this and even as an adult (as mentioned earlier) is super fun!
history.review_full:
Every time I see something like this I always think of the movie BIG where Tom Hanks is bouncing on a digital piano that is massive. Even though this is a different style (and instrument altogether) I always get excited when I get to try something like this.

My son is interested in band and plays the trumpet. I figured something like this for my 5 year old would be good and less chaotic in terms of crashing/smashing cymbals.

The sound quality is great and we’ve connected to both a Bluetooth speaker and a wired headset (separately). The speaker is way more entertaining.

The record feature may be better served for if my son (or sons) get better but it does also help when it comes to a battle of who played it best between the two.

The different settings are more than we need but a great feature. The ability to follow along with a preset beat also helps quite a bit. We did put this on an old school desk which works perfect for the setup (a desk with a fully removable seat).

Very happy we got this and even as an adult (as mentioned earlier) is super fun!

I think it works ok, just needs to be a very small area.

heldout.review_excerpt:
I missed the part where this mic has a receiver on it so the recording at 65’ makes so much more sense now.

I ended up doing a video review of this one since I was so pleased.

Volume / Clarity - definite improvement over the phone
Noise cancellation - I tested next to our fish tank and there was no sound picked up from the moving filters on the tank
Distance - my yard distance is about 35’ for open space so I tried it there and there was no noticeable difference in sound & any static. There was a light gust of wind on occasion that was always not picked up by the mic.

It does seem to last quite awhile AND both of the mics can be used at the same time with the same receiver so this would work quite well for a podcast!

history.review_excerpt: I tried a few cheaper one-off products (iRig Pre) to provide 48V Phantom Power and mic preamp functions for my Audio Technica AT2020 condenser mic, but sound quality was poor. The D-PRE inverted Darlington mic preamps in this are superb providing clean, pure sound with virtually no noise across its wide range of input gain and output levels. Quality design, well built, compact. Note that this is 2-band EQ, not 3-band (unless that's counting the HPF button on the preamp). Note that there is only one button that turns 48V phantom power on or off for both Mic 1 and Mic 2 inputs. So that might limit some configurations if using both inputs, one of which requires phantom power and the other doesnt.
history.review_full: I tried a few cheaper one-off products (iRig Pre) to provide 48V Phantom Power and mic preamp functions for my Audio Technica AT2020 condenser mic, but sound quality was poor.  This Yamaha MG06X is far and away superior.  The D-PRE inverted Darlington mic preamps in this are superb providing clean, pure sound with virtually no noise across its wide range of input gain and output levels.  Quality design, well built, compact.  Note that this is 2-band EQ, not 3-band (unless that's counting the HPF button on the preamp).  If you don't need the built-in effects, which are just OK, the MG06 would be a good alternative.  Note that there is only one button that turns 48V phantom power on or off for both Mic 1 and Mic 2 inputs.  So that might limit some configurations if using both inputs, one of which requires phantom power and the other doesnt.

product.title: Yamaha MG10 10-Input Stereo Mixer , Black

history.review_excerpt: The resistance I measured for the closed position was between 1-10 ohms, but it was not continuous over the range of pedal motion, it just varied randomly across those values after depressing the pedal about 75% down. So this is not a variable or 1/2 sustain pedal. On that SP-2 the resistance varies continuously from 175 ohms 75% depressed to 80 ohms 100% depressed. So it can be considered a variable or 1/2 sustain pedal. I deduct 1 star for the change in design and function over the years for the same product model number, but otherwise a fine product (so far, but not so sure after reading some of the recent reports of the newer ones failing within a year).
history.review_full: This M-Gear SP-2 sustain pedal has a feel of being well-built, sturdy, and stays put on a smooth floor.  This is the second I've bought, this one for the purpose of engaging the push-to-talk (PTT) function on a ham radio, and it works fine for that.  It takes about 8 pounds of weight to fully depress which is a bit heavy, but not too bad.  It functions bascially as a momentary electrical on/off switch, and there is an switch on the bottom to change whether it opens or closes the circuit when depressed.  The resistance I measured for the closed position was between 1-10 ohms, but it was not continuous over the range of pedal motion, it just varied randomly across those values after depressing the pedal about 75% down.  So this is not a variable or 1/2 sustain pedal.  It's either on or off.  This is different from the first SP-2 pedal I bought 10 years ago, which I still use today on my Triton Extreme.  On that SP-2 the resistance varies continuously from 175 ohms 75% depressed to 80 ohms 100% depressed.  So it can be considered a variable or 1/2 sustain pedal.  A global setting on the Triton Extreme allows calibration for half damper which works for this older pedal, but not for the new one.  Only a few of more advanced sound patches make use of this feature.  I deduct 1 star for the change in design and function over the years for the same product model number, but otherwise a fine product (so far, but not so sure after reading some of the recent reports of the newer ones failing within a year).
history.review_title: Works fine, sturdy, no half damper pedal function

product.title: M-Audio SP-2 - Universal Sustain Pedal with Piano Style Action For MIDI Keyboards, Digital Pianos & More

history.review_excerpt: [[VIDEOID:b4772ffc224ba647b8e7c5ac9ff9f0e4]] This is a nice looking kinnor / lyre and is reasonably well made. Just know this is not a premium lyre, so don't expect great sound. The resonance and harmonics can be quite nice at times. At times. At best it has the sound of plucked ukelele, at worst the sound of a a steel drum. Tuned to the recommended scale,  I couldn't get the highest note string to sound very good. The string was vibrating too much below the movable bridge, which combining with the pitch of the main part of the string created an unpleasant twangy sound. I've uploaded a short video sample of me playing which is representative of the sound you might expect.
history.review_full: [[VIDEOID:b4772ffc224ba647b8e7c5ac9ff9f0e4]] This is a nice looking kinnor / lyre and is reasonably well made.  The sound board is nice and flat, and the tuning pegs are firmly placed.  Just know this is not a premium lyre, so don't expect great sound.  The sound is OK when tuned well.  The resonance and harmonics can be quite nice at times.  At times.  At best it has the sound of plucked ukelele, at worst the sound of a a steel drum.  Tuned to the recommended scale,  I couldn't get the highest note string to sound very good.  The string was vibrating too much below the movable bridge, which combining with the pitch of the main part of the string created an unpleasant twangy sound.  I've uploaded a short video sample of me playing which is representative of the sound you might expect.

history.review_excerpt: I've "book-learned" morse code, but keying morse is another thing. Then I can tell whether I'm keying the letters and numbers correctly, and whether I'm pausing between letters and words correctly at different speeds. It works fine with either a 9V battery or a 12V DC adapter. The sound module is definitely analog, with some variation in pitch ("chirp"), but it's not a problem for practice. If connected to a radio, you must disconnect the key from the sound module hence it will not be used at all, so the chirp from the sound generation module isn't an issue. The tension and throw adjustments are a tried-and-true design that work well for light touch activation and release.
history.review_full: This is a solidly-built straight CW keyer.  I've "book-learned" morse code, but keying morse is another thing.  I practice using this with a morse code app that reads and decodes sound signals. It works fine with either a 9V battery or a 12V DC adapter.  The sound module is definitely analog, with some variation in pitch ("chirp"), but it's not a problem for practice. history.review_excerpt:
I would stop short of calling it perfect, though, not because of the bowl itself but because of the accessories with it.

The bowl itself is beautiful and has a clear, pure sound to it. The bowl itself is hammered brass and is very attractive.

However, there are several accessories with this bowl that take away from an otherwise good product. The little cushion is a doughnut-shaped pad that is hard and difficult to reshape, which is a problem because mine came with an odd lump in in it that should have been easy to smooth out. Mixing Buddhist meditation and Christian traditional verse is a mismatch that doesn't work.

I like the bowl quite a bit, but the accessories leave much to be desired.
history.review_full:
I selected this singing bowl to keep in my office, partly as a conversation piece, partly for décor, and partly for the sound when I need something pleasant. This is a neat little bowl with a nice, clear sound. I would stop short of calling it perfect, though, not because of the bowl itself but because of the accessories with it.

The bowl itself is beautiful and has a clear, pure sound to it. It's a pleasant tone that is calming and enjoyable to the ear. The bowl itself is hammered brass and is very attractive.

However, there are several accessories with this bowl that take away from an otherwise good product. The little cushion is a doughnut-shaped pad that is hard and difficult to reshape, which is a problem because mine came with an odd lump in in it that should have been easy to smooth out. The pestle is all right, but the one I received is rough and seems unfinished. Sandpaper will help somewhat but it needs more help than that. A dowel from a local hardware store is actually a better tool.

The medallion that comes with this bowl seems completely out of place. Mixing Buddhist meditation and Christian traditional verse is a mismatch that doesn't work.

I like the bowl quite a bit, but the accessories leave much to be desired. Hopefully some more thought will go into the packaging and will be corrected sooner rather than later.

product.title: REGIS Tibetan Singing Bowl Set ， Mindfulness, and Stress Relief zen decor，Bowl Handcrafted in Nepal for Healing and Mindfulness (3 inch)

history.review_excerpt:
This is not the guitar that an experienced player would want or use but it is a great starting point. For the cost, it is better than I expected, but this is relative - this is still a bare-bones configuration.

It comes with everything you need to start learning and hitting chords - the guitar itself, a cheap plastic stand, an extra set of strings, a small set of plastic picks, and an electronic tuner. The instrument is particularly light, the exceptionally lightweight bag, the plastic stand and the one jagged fret all point to a lower-end vision for this instrument.

The cost of this instrument counterbalances the quality, though.
history.review_full:
I am not a guitar expert but I know a good instrument from a bad one. I had not heard of RockJam before and based on the price I thought this would be a low-end guitar suitable for someone just learning or still toying with the idea of learning to play. This proved to be right. This is not the guitar that an experienced player would want or use but it is a great starting point. The cost alone makes this worth consideration.

This is a basic set-up, in every sense of the word. The guitar itself is lightweight and is made from base-level components, and as such it is not going to have the richness of sound of a higher-end instrument. For the cost, it is better than I expected, but this is relative - this is still a bare-bones configuration.

It comes with everything you need to start learning and hitting chords - the guitar itself, a cheap plastic stand, an extra set of strings, a small set of plastic picks, and an electronic tuner. There’s also a nylon carry bag for everything. The bag is of little or no protection at all and will not protect the guitar from anything more than getting dirty.

Looking over the guitar I was surprised to find that there weren’t too many obvious flaws. The veneer and varnish seem to be smooth and I found no peeling or bubbles, the inlay is smooth with no gaps, and the stock feels sturdy. One of the frets is slightly jagged on one end and probably not bad enough to nick the skin, but it is enough to feel it when I glide my hand over it. Careful work with a small file can alleviate this if yours has the same issue.

While it might appear to be made well at a glance, everything about this guitar suggests it was manufactured for economy more than quality. The instrument is particularly light, the exceptionally lightweight bag, the plastic stand and the one jagged fret all point to a lower-end vision for this instrument.

The cost of this instrument counterbalances the quality, though. For under $100 this is actually a decent instrument, ideal for someone who still is unsure of whether or not they want to play guitar or if they’re just starting out and wanting to learn the basics. Someone who has been playing for a while will likely be less than impressed, while someone who started with this guitar is very likely to move on to a better instrument eventually.

For the cost, this is a fine option if you’re wanting a bare-bones configuration for learning or piquing interest. This is not the set-up you want for an experienced, player, though.
history.review_title: Barebones Configuration for Students; Priced Right

history.review_excerpt:
They fit snugly but not tight so I can tilt my head down and not have them slip off and they do not pinch my ears. The bass is good though not overdriven to the point of headache-inducing (overdriving the bass is a common trait for headphones these days, so balancing the bass like these do is a very positive thing). These aren’t audiophile-level phones, but they’re closer than most I have used, in any price range.

I cranked up the volume and they did not distort.

If I could change two things about these, I would make them over-the-ear phones so they’d be comfortable for longer periods of time, and I would add a carry case or back to the package to protect them or at least make them easy to carry and keep everything together.

It should be noted that these are wired-only phones.
history.review_full:
I have had good experiences with Pioneer audio equipment and electronics so I had high expectations of these headphones. These have proven to be better than their asking price would suggest.

These are on-ear headphones which is not my normal preference. Normally, I go for over-the-ear headphones because they tend to be more comfortable. That said, these are more comfortable than most other on-ear headphones I have used. They fit snugly but not tight so I can tilt my head down and not have them slip off and they do not pinch my ears. After a little while I do need to take them off, though, as they do start to get a little uncomfortable. The pads are reasonably soft and there is even a replacement set of pads in the box - a very pleasant surprise.

Also included in the box are two audio cables and a 1/4" converter.

The sound profile is spot-on. The bass is good though not overdriven to the point of headache-inducing (overdriving the bass is a common trait for headphones these days, so balancing the bass like these do is a very positive thing). The midrange is warm and seems to be balanced correctly, so that music does not sound hollow or like it’s in a tunnel. The highs are bright and very clear. The sound profile is so well tuned that I have found myself listening to old tracks that I have listened to for years and am hearing things I never noticed before. These aren’t audiophile-level phones, but they’re closer than most I have used, in any price range.

I cranked up the volume and they did not distort.

If I could change two things about these, I would make them over-the-ear phones so they’d be comfortable for longer periods of time, and I would add a carry case or back to the package to protect them or at least make them easy to carry and keep everything together.

It should be noted that these are wired-only phones. These do not have Bluetooth capability.

These beat my expectations which were already high. These have a very solid sound profile that approaches audiophile quality for far less than should be expected at the price point. They’re more comfortable than many on-ear phones that I’ve used in the past, and they come with replacement pads which is a bonus. If you want a really nice set of phones that delivers solid sound and won’t break the bank, these should be on the short list.

heldout.review_excerpt:
I have gone through just about every model of quick locking clutches on the market. Some are exceptional; some not so much. This one is the easiest and most effective one that I have used.

That said, it will NOT work with the older hi-hats that have the smaller mounting holes, which were in use up to the mid-1950s. The only modern clutch I have found that accommodates those are the DW ones that come with their light (flush) hi-hat stands. And those are NOT quick locking.

I highly recommend this clutch if you are using modern hi-hat cymbals.

heldout.review_excerpt:
The electric guitar is another thing, it really doesn't make much of a sound without an amp and so this little thing is great if you want to practice or play to a small group.
This amp is less expensive than some others, and has some good features. I got the blue one and it is easy to use the features.
I'm not sure the tone does anythng but the overdrive definitely gives you some great sound.
The only thing I wish it had was microphone input. The Aux is only for other audio input evidently, and most of the things I'd want to bring in I can do with the Bluetooth, so it was disappointing that I couldn't plug in a mike.
Overall, it is a nice amp, not great which is why I'm only giving it 4 start.
heldout.review_full:
These little portable amps are good but they have limitations. Some of them actually have clips where you can clip them to your belt so you can take your amp with you. This one doesn't have a clip but it's still a nice little amp.
I have an acoustic/electric and an electric guitar and it's not very useful for the acoustic. The guitar itself is loud enough but maybe if I was playing out on the deck/patio/porch, it would be helpful. The electric guitar is another thing, it really doesn't make much of a sound without an amp and so this little thing is great if you want to practice or play to a small group.
This amp is less expensive than some others, and has some good features. I liked the ability to use bluetooth input, so you can play along with your favorite songs. The headphone jack was also a nice feature, and it gives you options. There are also headphone only amps that plug into the guitar but they don't have the ability to have other people hear what you are playing (this can be good or bad depending on the situation). I also like the form. I got the blue one and it is easy to use the features.
I'm not sure the tone does anythng but the overdrive definitely gives you some great sound.
The only thing I wish it had was microphone input. When I saw the Aux input, I thought it could allow you to use a microphone so you could sing along, but it didn't work that way. The Aux is only for other audio input evidently, and most of the things I'd want to bring in I can do with the Bluetooth, so it was disappointing that I couldn't plug in a mike.
Overall, it is a nice amp, not great which is why I'm only giving it 4 start. If you are looking for an inexpensive amp this is one you should consider.

history.review_excerpt:
Perhaps it was from the first time I heard Skrillex's "First of the Year," but definitely by the time I heard the dubstepped version of "Pumped up Kicks." I'm serious, I researched tools to do this, and I could not be happier when I got a chance to get this DJ controller. The problem so far is that I can't do these things, but I'm learning.

This device does have a learning curve, although, fun can be had right out of the box. But I got DJing for Dummies, I've watched videos and it is coming along.

This is obviously more toy than profession here, but I am happy with the feature set. I would like there to be better jogs, and I can tell that it is limited in many ways, but holy crap it was exactly what I was hoping for.
history.review_full:
Alright, to let you know where this review is coming from. I am a middle aged, out of shape man with all the music theory that a middleschool second chair trombonist has. But I also have a dream to make a Dubstep version of Michael Martin Murphy's wildfire. This is not a recent dream, but one that I have had for some time. Perhaps it was from the first time I heard Skrillex's "First of the Year," but definitely by the time I heard the dubstepped version of "Pumped up Kicks." I'm serious, I researched tools to do this, and I could not be happier when I got a chance to get this DJ controller. It does everything I was hoping to do with it. It can sample it can loop, it can bring down the bass to get hollowed out vocals, and the chance to solidly DROP THE BASS! The problem so far is that I can't do these things, but I'm learning.

This device does have a learning curve, although, fun can be had right out of the box. We set it up in about 20 minutes and had it pumping out some House/Trance hybrids in no time. We had a small rave with the kids grabbing the headphone and controls while the others watched, staring not dancing. We loved the lights, we loved playing with the wrist bands while I waited for my turn... That's where it went a little south. While I could make lots of interesting effects, I realized I have a long ways to go before dub stepping a little 70's gold. But I got DJing for Dummies, I've watched videos and it is coming along.

This is obviously more toy than profession here, but I am happy with the feature set. I would like there to be better jogs, and I can tell that it is limited in many ways, but holy crap it was exactly what I was hoping for. Inexpensive, feature rich enough for my needs, and most importantly fun. I will put up any resulting mix here when it comes together.

Rating it five stars based on the fun and affordable entry into DJing.
history.review_title: A Fun and Affordable Entry to DJ'ing, but Probably a Little Toyish

product.title: Hercules Instinct P8 Party Pack

history.review_excerpt: Already, my 16 year old has demonstrated that he can play the John Williams classics from Star Wars to Jurassic park and we are working on Melody lines from old Cure songs to go with the Ukulele. It is definitely plastic and a little on the cheaper side of build, but the sound is good (in as much as the toy horn sound these create can be "good.")  It plays well with keys that are considerably smaller than piano keys, but big enough to play. I do not recommend for long car rides, but I do recommend having one of these on hand for musical experimentation. And at this price point ($19) this is a great melodica to start with.
history.review_full:
My kids have always played strange little instruments like ipod keyboards and tinker more than play on anything. I have long wanted to get a Melodica so we could have nerdy jams with Ukuleles, Percussion, and a Melodica for melody lines. Already, my 16 year old has demonstrated that he can play the John Williams classics from Star Wars to Jurassic park and we are working on Melody lines from old Cure songs to go with the Ukulele. This really is the perfect, quirky instrument to play around with.

As far as Melodicas go, this is not the most premium side of the line. It is definitely plastic and a little on the cheaper side of build, but the sound is good (in as much as the toy horn sound these create can be "good.") It plays well with keys that are considerably smaller than piano keys, but big enough to play. I like the assortment of mouth parts for squeamish experimenters.

All in all, this is a very decent intro to Melodica and we are having fun with it. I do not recommend for long car rides, but I do recommend having one of these on hand for musical experimentation. And at this price point ($19) this is a great melodica to start with.

history.review_full:
I got a reviewer set and was hoping that it would do a decent job of picking up better sound in the field, but had no hope of the quality of sound this is providing. My partner's son has to do a series of videos for his speech class and we have been using this to do better than the microphone on his camera. This is allowing him to roam in front of the camera with no drop in audio quality. We are not Pros by any means, but this is giving us a very polished and professional sounding end product, and sound is what differentiates good videos from bad most times.

It was very easy to set up. We did have to use a stereo jack adapter for our iPhone but otherwise had everything in the box. We also ended up using a better iPhone tripod than the one that came. The one the comes in the kit is functional but not as good as others we have. The Mic seems pretty rugged and works like any other lavalier mic.

All in all, I am very impressed with the functionality and quality of this mic.

history.review_excerpt:
But, one of the reasons I got the TV was because it was one of ones that had HDR.

I used rtings' (http://www.rtings.com/tv/reviews/samsung/js8500/settings) calibration settings to sharpen the picture. It is pretty much theater quality if you can sit within about 8 1/2 feet of the screen. When the shots are dark you see much more detail than I saw on my previous TV, which was a 2010 47" 1080p LG. But, it was no where near the quality of this TV: a 5-6 vs this one that's a 9-10.

I thought about the Samsung JS9000, which is $1,000 more - pretty much just for the curved screen. I haven't watched a night football game yet.

My wife says: "It's awesome!".
history.review_full:
We've had this TV a little more than 2 weeks. When the price dropped to $1997 on Amazon, I snapped it up. For the money, it is the best 4K TV out there. The smart controls work great, allowing you to use apps or browse the Internet on the TV, including side-by-side while you are watching TV. There's only a little 4k stuff out, mostly on Netflix - oceans, desserts, underwater world, etc. They are fantastic! Eventually, there will be more 4k. Haven't tried HDR yet. But, one of the reasons I got the TV was because it was one of ones that had HDR.

I used rtings' (http://www.rtings.com/tv/reviews/samsung/js8500/settings) calibration settings to sharpen the picture. Rtings really likes this TV: http://www.rtings.com/tv/reviews/by-size/65-inch/best. It is their second best after the much pricier LG OLED. This review influenced my purchase.

One of the main reason I got this TV was to watch movies. It is pretty much theater quality if you can sit within about 8 1/2 feet of the screen. You start to get the immersion effect when you are a little less the 9 feet away. The picture is still excellent from 10 feet, but you don't quite get the immersion effect. When the shots in the movie are bright, sunny and colorful, the view is spectacular - wow! When the shots are dark you see much more detail than I saw on my previous TV, which was a 2010 47" 1080p LG. It was a good TV that I had professionally calibrated. But, it was no where near the quality of this TV: a 5-6 vs this one that's a 9-10.

I thought about the Samsung JS9000, which is $1,000 more - pretty much just for the curved screen. Didn't think it was worth it. The LG OLED 65" is better. Pretty much every review says so. But, it's priced at $4k, which is more than I wanted to spend.

For sports, everything is really good. No judder that I've noticed. Daytime watching is plenty bright enough. Amazing picture, especially when the field is in full sunshine. I haven't watched a night football game yet.

My wife says: "It's awesome!".
history.review_title: Awesome TV. At $2K, it is an excellent value too.

history.review_excerpt:
I've tried other products from dry cloths, to alcohol rubs, to my t-shirt, nothing else comes close to clearning so thoroughly. It works much better than the smoother side.

I fold the cloth in half so there are two of these rough sides. I use one side to do the initial cleaning and the other side to do the final - perfection clean.

Then, I fold the cloth inside out to clean off my finger tips before discarding the cloth.

A suggestion - could you make a biodegradable wrapper?

The price varies between 10 and 17 cents. Obviously, it's better when you get them for the lower price by buying a larger quantity.
history.review_full:
Try them. You will love them. Guaranteed.

I've been using iCloths for several years now. They are the perfect phone screen cleaner, hands down!! I've tried other products from dry cloths, to alcohol rubs, to my t-shirt, nothing else comes close to clearning so thoroughly. One cloth is plenty!!

They may see a little too dry to work when you are first using them. Don't worry. They are the perfect moistness.

A trick. One side of the cloth is more rough than the other. Use the rough side to clear the phone screen. It works much better than the smoother side.

I fold the cloth in half so there are two of these rough sides. I use one side to do the initial cleaning and the other side to do the final - perfection clean.

Then, I fold the cloth inside out to clean off my finger tips before discarding the cloth.

A suggestion - could you make a biodegradable wrapper?

The price varies between 10 and 17 cents. Obviously, it's better when you get them for the lower price by buying a larger quantity.

I wish this came in a smaller size so I could carry it in my purse (they should have included a small bottle that you could refill for portability). Outside of that, for the money you can't do better.

history.review_excerpt: These are fantastic headphones and I love that i can have my cell phone plugged in at a central location in my house and walk around the house and still listen to music or my book. the range for me is about 30' and the headphones will disconnect if i go outside and then reconnect when i get close to my phone again. I love the 1 click pause feature so i can quickly pause what i am listening to talk to someone (i don't have to go find my phone and swipe and pause). I had an issue about 1 year after I bought the headphones and the customer service was wonderful and understanding. really great product and I will continue to purchase and recommend these to my friends.
history.review_full: These are fantastic headphones and I love that i can have my cell phone plugged in at a central location in my house and walk around the house and still listen to music or my book. the range for me is about 30' and the headphones will disconnect if i go outside and then reconnect when i get close to my phone again. If my phone is in my pocket it will stay connected where ever i go. I love listening to things without being attached or tethered to my phone. It also makes it harder for my kids to pull the earphones out of my ears when there is no long cord attached to my phone. I love the 1 click pause feature so i can quickly pause what i am listening to talk to someone (i don't have to go find my phone and swipe and pause). They are comfortable and stay on really well for my ears. I have taken them running and they stayed on as well. I had an issue about 1 year after I bought the headphones and the customer service was wonderful and understanding. really great product and I will continue to purchase and recommend these to my friends.

history.review_excerpt:
I purchased a three pack of Stonwash Sugar & Cream yarn, a brand I have used hundreds of times. But this package had to be "seconds" because the quality was well below what I expected. It was so thin I had to go down to a 4mm hook in order to use it for a simple dish cloth.

history.review_excerpt: I used red paint for window frames and 4 of the gas pumps, white for two of the other pumps, silver for rain downspouts and vent on the roof and aged concrete for the pump islands. (I have it, use it and it works well.)  The kit comes with 3 different sets of 6 gas pumps, so you can use the pumps that fit the era you are modeling. Unfortunately there are only two pump islands, so you can't swap pumps if you want to change the era, even though you have the pumps for the 3 eras. Also this kit and all the garage and gas station kits I have bought and assembled do not come with a base or concrete driveways, so you have to create your own; I used heavy card stock and gray spray paint.
history.review_full: Very fast and easy assembly.  It does need some painting to look realistic, since it is all molded in a single color (white) or actually two if you count the clear window glass material.  I used red paint for window frames and 4 of the gas pumps, white for two of the other pumps, silver for rain downspouts and vent on the roof and aged concrete for the pump islands.  Instruction sheet is easy to follow with parts numbered.  I have not quite finished building yet, as one thing is holding me up.  In the pictures on the box, it shows several thin black lines on the trim and I don't know how to get those put on without it oozing over into the white.  Even a very thin brush might not work; maybe a toothpick?  The kit comes with decals and I AWAYS have trouble with decals and usually end up destroying some of them.  What I do as a precaution is to make a couple color photocopies of the decals and then I can always cut out the pieces and glue them on in lieu of the decals. If you really want to do your decals well, you also need to buy a bottle of Micro Sol, which softens the decal and makes them adhere better. (I have it, use it and it works well.)  The kit comes with 3 different sets of 6 gas pumps, so you can use the pumps that fit the era you are modeling.  Unfortunately there are only two pump islands, so you can't swap pumps if you want to change the era, even though you have the pumps for the 3 eras.  (Too bad the kit didn't include three sets of pump islands.)  The only other thing that defines the era is the standing sign; two signs included; one to accommodate Standard oil and the other to accommodate either "Al's Victory Service" or "Jerry's Gas and Garage" on the sign.  The only thing that I really did not like about this kit is that the gas pumps seem to lack detail.  They don't look like they have any dispenser hoses on them; that can make a big difference in realism.  The decals are a bit "congested" on the decal sheet, so be careful.  Also be careful with the plastic sprues that the parts are attached to.  There are a few very tiny parts that can come loose; I almost lost the air pump when it fell off.  This is a decent gas station kit and probably a good kit for a beginner, but I do think there are better looking gas station kits out there.  Generally the Walthers kits are nice, but need a lot of painting to look realistic.  This kit needs less painting than some other kits.  Note: there are quite a few small pieces, so you need patience.  Also this kit and all the garage and gas station kits I have bought and assembled do not come with a base or concrete driveways, so you have to create your own; I used heavy card stock and gray spray paint.  The concrete joints can be made with a lead pencil and a ruler and look quite realistic.
history.review_title: Easy and Fast to Assemble; needs some painting to look realistic

product.title: Walthers Cornerstone Series Kit HO Scale Al's Victory Service Station

history.review_excerpt: It doesn't dry too fast, so you have a little time to move the parts around slightly to get a good fit, before you have a permanent bond. There are glues out there that are more liquid, but was always afraid to use them for fear of them running too much and ruining the features on the plastic. Note that this glue (and most plastic glues) works by dissolving a little of the plastic, so you do have to be careful not to use too much. The only problem I have had with this glue is that you have to be careful to squeeze the tubes evenly or they can break through; they are made of a soft metal that tends to puncture if you aren't paying attention to how the tube gets crimped as you use up the glue.
history.review_full: Have used Testors Plastic Cement for decades and it has always been my choice for assembling plastic models.  It is sticky enough to adhere well and dries well and makes a good bond.  It doesn't dry too fast, so you have a little time to move the parts around slightly to get a good fit, before you have a permanent bond.  There are glues out there that are more liquid, but was always afraid to use them for fear of them running too much and ruining the features on the plastic.  Note that this glue (and most plastic glues) works by dissolving a little of the plastic, so you do have to be careful not to use too much. If it oozes too much out of the joints you are gluing, it can damage the features of the plastic.  The only problem I have had with this glue is that you have to be careful to squeeze the tubes evenly or they can break through; they are made of a soft metal that tends to puncture if you aren't paying attention to how the tube gets crimped as you use up the glue.  Testors also makes a good line of paints for models.
history.review_title: My choice always for plastic model work

Ok fine if you wanna sell DEFECTIVE stamps, but be HONEST about it so ppl don’t waste their time, $, & energy on DEFECTIVE items they would not have chosen to begin with. It would make an ok gift for kids if you can find them on sale & know 1/4 are useless imo. Safety warning: buy the safety gloves amazon sells so you don’t knick ur own fingers or just start by being smart & using a tweezers or cuticle stick to hold down the stamps while you remove the bird names. Me, myself, & I am too old to start learning how to live without appendages so I always make sure something else is between me, myself, & I & anything Me, myself, & I am cutting.
history.review_full:
Lowered from a 3 star review to a 1 star bc the very obviously defective stamps were replaced with another set of very obviously defective stamps! It drives me nuts to waste my time, $, & energy to purchase something, wait on it to arrive, then go through the hassle of the returns to then wait for a replacement only to have the replacement be just as defective or often worse than the original. Apparently the entire tim of these stamps was bad & nobody ever bothered to fix it. Ok fine if you wanna sell DEFECTIVE stamps, but be HONEST about it so ppl don’t waste their time, $, & energy on DEFECTIVE items they would not have chosen to begin with. I am sure some ppl would still purchase the set. I might even at the right price point, but not like this. Not believing I’m buying something in good condition & not a DEFECTIVE item which both of these are.
OLD REVIEW:
Some of these are pretty nice, but the cardinal & starling are a hot mess. The pigeon is flawed too, but works. Idk if their designer messed up or their manufacturer did, but the actual bird designs are not true to life on several either which I find to be most annoying as a bird lover. It would make an ok gift for kids if you can find them on sale & know 1/4 are useless imo. I have no idea why they bothered to put the bird names on the stamps bc you cannot read them. Great in theory, but lousy execution. I would definitely buy them again if they fixed the flaws & I am actually hoping that Amazon will replace them as these are flawed & I am just stupid enough, foolish enough, naive enough, or hopeful enough that the replacement will arrive perfect. Lol! Yes ppl- I live in my own little make believe world. It’s downright magical & days like today I truly prefer my imagination world where anything & everything is possible & Covid doesn’t exist & ppl don’t hate each other for their politics & ppl believe in peace & abhor war to the real one happening outside my door right now. Bottom line: some birds good, some birds very bad, do yourself a favor & cut the names of the birds off the stamps if you choose to buy them & keep them. It’s just a little minor surgery between friends & nobody gets hurt. Besides: doesn’t everyone feel like wielding a sharp instrument every now & then? Especially when you know nobody is going to get hurt? Lol. Safety warning: buy the safety gloves amazon sells so you don’t knick ur own fingers or just start by being smart & using a tweezers or cuticle stick to hold down the stamps while you remove the bird names. Me, myself, & I am too old to start learning how to live without appendages so I always make sure something else is between me, myself, & I & anything Me, myself, & I am cutting. Yes- I am totes all up in my feelings today. All full of myself hence the me, myself, & I. Lol. Happy crafting shoppers! Now get off ur devices & make something! This is a throw down: I hereby challenge you to create a bird journal arts & crafts page today. That’s it! Clock is ticking! Get a move on! Now! Now! Now! Why yes! I was in the Navy! What gave me, myself & I away? Lol. Peace & Love ppl. Live ur beautiful lives!

history.review_excerpt:
I’m disabled & I live on a fixed income so purchasing products that are consumable & have to be replaced drives me nuts to begin with, but then purchasing a consumable item that has a shelf life of used twice & now useless is beyond frustrating. As I have adhd & usually need little sleep it’s always a possibility lol.

Unfortunately I was in an accident on 2/4 so I only got to try these a couple of times (literally 2x!!! & was bedridden & unable to do anything after that until today 3/24 when I opened these again & decided to try to carve a stamp of my Pekingese /Japanese Chin/ Shih Tzu mix puppy Sophie Wynter. It doesn’t make the pain go away, but it does give me something to remind myself that I survived another day with the help of my service pups.
The Stamps: great out of the pkg.
history.review_full:
[[VIDEOID:8644a01103c90ab8f83af816b83881be]] Likes: the colors are fabulous. I love that the stamp pads can be stacked! I like that I can run my stamps over the pad & not just press it down inside a stamp pad. Yes, it messes up the coloring, but I can use it on larger stamps.
Dislikes: the pads are very thin & dried out very fast while literally just sitting in my craft room & not even being used which is seriously annoying me right now. I’m disabled & I live on a fixed income so purchasing products that are consumable & have to be replaced drives me nuts to begin with, but then purchasing a consumable item that has a shelf life of used twice & now useless is beyond frustrating. If I had realized before I would have returned it for a replacement obviously bc even tho I now know it’s not got longevity on its side I would probably still purchase it & just be ready to go on a stamping marathon. Lol. As I have adhd & usually need little sleep it’s always a possibility lol.

Unfortunately I was in an accident on 2/4 so I only got to try these a couple of times (literally 2x!!! Woe is me!). & was bedridden & unable to do anything after that until today 3/24 when I opened these again & decided to try to carve a stamp of my Pekingese /Japanese Chin/ Shih Tzu mix puppy Sophie Wynter. Btw: the stamp carving kit is the speedball one sold here on Amazon for $15. I also bought the one by Pixiss for around $10 I think and honestly both are worth the $ imo. I live in chronic pain & I am always trying to find things that will help get my mind off the horrors of living with it day in & day out. It doesn’t make the pain go away, but it does give me something to remind myself that I survived another day with the help of my service pups.
The Stamps: great out of the pkg. they were moist & juicy, but had no staying power. If you have kids that will use them fast or if you intend to use them fast then I think you will like them. However, if you are looking for something to add to your craft stores for ongoing project & future projects & would want to go back & add to stuff later then you need to keep looking or just be prepared to buy more.

history.review_full: These are regular mica powders!  One appears to have had some interference added, but the others are devoid of the addition.  They have literally just mixed 3 colors together so instead of getting the cute colors they advertise in their photos you get an ugly brown from the purple/red-blue/green, a gold from the blue/green/gold & a bronze from the yellow/orange/bronze.  Only one of my envelopes even appeared to have the added micas. Two envelopes appeared to only have the hold mica and bronze mica without the additional two colors they were supposed to have as if they decided to just not even bother adding them.  I purchased these to make color shift watercolor paints & as such they are utterly useless. There is no way in the world that you can possibly get the results that they advertise in they’re pictures from the envelopes they mail you. It is physically & chemically impossible!  I am disgusted.  $8 for 15 grams of useless product & worse it’s the exact same mica powders “Riya” that I purchased in a set of 100 last week & had already tried to mix that way for a color shift which was why I was specifically looking for color shift mica!  These are metallic. They are in no way color shift!  Now I’ll have to see what the return/refund policy is with amazon as how do you return something you have made & put into ur own paint palettes before you found out they were garbage? Hmm?

After using this for about a month now, I can say I feel a difference. The warmth, heat has made the pain minimize and I feel great after using it for about 15-20 minutes. history.review_excerpt:
Within a week of taking this thymus (I began with two capsules and worked up to three the following week, then increase week after and so on), my body began to handle foods differently. I was able to handle it daily for several days then two days off....then back on since I'm also taking their Spleen for increasing my iron levels and ferritin (iron storage) between iron infusions due to chronic anemia back in fall of last year.

The owner, Brian, is absolutely awesome for answering questions with honorable ethics behind the product. As someone who is incredibly sensitive to any kind of fillers or additives and even gelcaps of supplements and medications, I am honored and happy to stand behind this product's purity.
history.review_full:
I had quite an experience in the past year with histamine intolerance...reactions to anything with yeast or foods that were high histamine such as coffee, avocado, B vitamins and wine. All that along with chronic cross reactions with foods related to birch. Within a week of taking this thymus (I began with two capsules and worked up to three the following week, then increase week after and so on), my body began to handle foods differently. I also switched from Benadryl to Cetirizine Hydrochlorate (generic Zyrtec by Up and Up brand from Target which is only soy-free one I could find) along with Famotidine by Up and Up (also soy-free version of Pepcid) and simply took this Ancestral Thymus, nothing else except pure food. I have noticed a positive difference in how my body handles outdoor allergens on the days I take this.

I gave my grandfather some to try and after three days he ordered it and a week later told me his knee pain was disappearing (I think its due to the increase in his iron). I highly recommend this product. If you have a severe grass allergy start off low and alternate days to see how your body handles it...everyone is different. I was able to handle it daily for several days then two days off....then back on since I'm also taking their Spleen for increasing my iron levels and ferritin (iron storage) between iron infusions due to chronic anemia back in fall of last year.

The owner, Brian, is absolutely awesome for answering questions with honorable ethics behind the product. As someone who is incredibly sensitive to any kind of fillers or additives and even gelcaps of supplements and medications, I am honored and happy to stand behind this product's purity. There is absolutely no added ANYTHING and the gelatin is made from grass-fed bovine from the very same beef. Thank you, Brian and family for all you do.
history.review_title: Had some really amazing results with the Thymus so far! *Histamine**Allergies*

heldout.review_excerpt:
The fact that the oils are SO fresh upon opening nine months later says a lot.

A few things you have to understand:

The negative review about allergy upon skin contact is only ONE case. As someone with a ton of skin sensitivities and contact dermatitis, I also got a tiny bit itchy with mixing the orange, lemongrass and rosemary onto my skin but THAT'S BECAUSE YOU'RE NOT SUPPOSED TO DO THAT. Yes, they also have a line of 100% essential oils but these are a much better value. If you are making a batch of homemade lotion, DIY sanitizers or whatever else, you add like 4-5 drops for every CUP of product. That said, this is actually a REALLY great value for this entire set.
heldout.review_full:
I bought this set last June and just opened it now. The fact that the oils are SO fresh upon opening nine months later says a lot.

A few things you have to understand:

The negative review about allergy upon skin contact is only ONE case. As someone with a ton of skin sensitivities and contact dermatitis, I also got a tiny bit itchy with mixing the orange, lemongrass and rosemary onto my skin but THAT'S BECAUSE YOU'RE NOT SUPPOSED TO DO THAT. These are 100% essential oil, NOT mixed with any kind of carrier. If you go to Whole Foods and buy one of the AuraCacia oils, many are mixed with jojoba oil so that they are easier on skin. Yes, they also have a line of 100% essential oils but these are a much better value. These are FULL POTENCY and VOLATILE which means yes, they *can* burn skin and SHOULD NOT be used on or around pets (do research as I know some oils are poisonous to cats). Any full potency oil can be extremely toxic to children if ingested. If you are making a batch of homemade lotion, DIY sanitizers or whatever else, you add like 4-5 drops for every CUP of product. More than that is going to be way too much. That said, this is actually a REALLY great value for this entire set. And non-GMO, Organic?!!! AMAZING.
heldout.review_title: LOTS OF ALLERGIES AND BEST Essential Oils I Ever Bought.

history.review_excerpt: I bought this product to contain my medication and supplements. It's exactly as described and works very well. I found the locking system to be annoying and unnecessary (I do not live with children). Each compartment has a little plastic hook that fits under the locking bar. When you push a button on the side the lock bar slides allowing the compartment to open. I disabled this by trimming the plastic hooks. The case still closes securely without the locking mechanism and it hasn't opened in my bag or when I dropped it. I think it's an excellent case because it can be used with the lock or be easily modified to be used without it.

history.review_excerpt: Sharpie has always made quality writing implements and markers and these are no exception. The ones I got were attractive white in color on the barrel with a comfortable grey colored grip. These are medium tip, which seems better to me than the bold, which tend to make more of a blob when writing. If you have never used a gel pen, you owe it to yourself to try them. These are as good as any gel pens and probably better than some. Gel pens are a little more expensive that typical ballpoint pens, but worth it once you have used one. You will never want to go back to a regular old ballpoint. One precaution with gel ink - until it dries, it does tend to smear easier than some other inks.
history.review_full: Sharpie has always made quality writing implements and markers and these are no exception.  The ones I got were attractive white in color on the barrel with a comfortable grey colored grip.  These are medium tip, which seems better to me than the bold, which tend to make more of a blob when writing.  If you have never used a gel pen, you owe it to yourself to try them.  These are as good as any gel pens and probably better than some.  Gel pens are a little more expensive that typical ballpoint pens, but worth it once you have used one.  You will never want to go back to a regular old ballpoint.  One precaution with gel ink - until it dries, it does tend to smear easier than some other inks.

history.review_excerpt: My wife has an electric stapler, but it is 2 or 3 times larger than this one; hers has a light on the front that flashes when staples are low and a small drawer on it for extra staples. The nicest thing is that it is not much bigger than a standard stapler, so it packs a lot of punch in a small size. Measures only 7 x 3 x 2 inches. The cord on the A/C adapter is nice and long, so you don't have to be really close to a power plug. If you don't want to plug it into the wall, it also operates from four double A batteries (not included). The model I got is solid black in color, which is fine for me; don't know if it comes in other colors or not. Register online and they give you an 18 month warranty. Absolutely a 5-star product.
history.review_full: My wife has an electric stapler, but it is 2 or 3 times larger than this one; hers has a light on the front that flashes when staples are low and a small drawer on it for extra staples.  This doesn't have extra features; it is just a basic stapler.  The nicest thing is that it is not much bigger than a standard stapler, so it packs a lot of punch in a small size.  Measures only 7 x 3 x 2 inches.  The cord on the A/C adapter is nice and long, so you don't have to be really close to a power plug.  It does staple through a lot of pages, as advertised.  It includes a manual staple puller and a box of staples in the package, which was a nice surprise that I didn't expect.  If you don't want to plug it into the wall, it also operates from four double A batteries (not included).  The model I got is solid black in color, which is fine for me; don't know if it comes in other colors or not.  Register online and they give you an 18 month warranty.  Absolutely a 5-star product.

product.title: Electric Stapler, Automatic Stapler, Electric Stapler Desktop, AC or Battery Powered Heavy Duty Stapler for Desk, with Reload Reminder & Release Button, 25 Sheets Capacity, Black

history.review_excerpt: This phone has a lot of nice features and is easy to use and program. It does require A/C power to operate, but has battery backup when there is a power failure. The only problem I have encountered with this phone is that it does not work with an inline call blocking device that I have. I have a mechanical call blocker that goes between the phone line and the phone, but if that device is plugged in, the phone will not work. It doesn't even have to be plugged into this phone; put it anywhere on the line and it makes this phone go dead. Unfortunately the phone itself doesn't include a call blocking feature, which is too bad.
history.review_full: This phone has a lot of nice features and is easy to use and program.  It does require A/C power to operate, but has battery backup when there is a power failure.  It does use FIVE AAA batteries, which seems like a lot.  Batteries don't come with it.  The only problem I have encountered with this phone is that it does not work with an inline call blocking device that I have.  I have a mechanical call blocker that goes between the phone line and the phone, but if that device is plugged in, the phone will not work.  It doesn't even have to be plugged into this phone; put it anywhere on the line and it makes this phone go dead.  Unfortunately the phone itself doesn't include a call blocking feature, which is too bad.  Being sold as a business phone, it should have call blocking.
history.review_title: Lots of features; easy to use

history.review_excerpt: This will probably be of limited use to me, as the labels that came with it are only 1 1/4 inches long and about 1/2 inch wide. You can buy longer labels I guess, but a little pricey at $13 for 65 labels (on sale) for colored labels or $12 for white labels. That means labels will cost you 18 to 20 cents each. Normal price is $20 for 65 labels on the website. The application is a little difficult to figure out, but I was able to get a label prepared and printed. The printer is small and completely wireless, although you need a USB cord (included) to charge it. Great for on the road printing of small labels, but you need you cell phone to use it.
history.review_full: This will probably be of limited use to me, as the labels that came with it are only 1 1/4 inches long and about 1/2 inch wide.  You can buy longer labels I guess, but a little pricey at $13 for 65 labels (on sale) for colored labels or $12 for white labels.  That means labels will cost you 18 to 20 cents each.  Normal price is $20 for 65 labels on the website.  You have to install an application on your cellphone to use the label printer.  I was disappointed that there didn't seem to be a way to install the application on my desktop computer.  Maybe it is because the device communicates via Bluetooth and my computer probably doesn't have Bluetooth support.  The application is a little difficult to figure out, but I was able to get a label prepared and printed. The printer is small and completely wireless, although you need a USB cord (included) to charge it.  Very compact printer, about the size of a pack of cigarettes.  Great for on the road printing of small labels, but you need you cell phone to use it.

history.review_excerpt: Idk if I just got a bad batch which is possible I suppose bc let’s face it sometimes companies have bad manufacturing runs, but all 4 of my pens are a total pain to use. I own well over 200 fountain pens & calligraphy pens of versing widths & I have a large collection of inks as well. I also tried these out on every type of paper I have from Tomoe River to Mead & composition notebooks, but the pens I have are just useless for me as they will not write fluidly. These are a huge let down as they have so many high reviews & I just wasn’t expecting them to be so awful. In my experience I tend to get another item from the same bad quality lot (or worse).
history.review_full: Idk if I just got a bad batch which is possible I suppose bc let’s face it sometimes companies have bad manufacturing runs, but all 4 of my pens are a total pain to use. They skip or the ink just does not flow at all no matter how hard I press on the Nov & then I get a puddle of ink.  Every once in a blue moon if I dip them in ink they seem to work a bit better, but it’s definitely not how they were meant to be used. I am not a newbie either. I own well over 200 fountain pens & calligraphy pens of versing widths & I have a large collection of inks as well. I also tried these out on every type of paper I have from Tomoe River to Mead & composition notebooks, but the pens I have are just useless for me as they will not write fluidly.  If I wanted to stop & start a hundred x I would just stick with my dip pens.  These are a huge let down as they have so many high reviews & I just wasn’t expecting them to be so awful.  Idk if I’m going to try the amazon replacement or not.  In my experience I tend to get another item from the same bad quality lot (or worse).  Decisions, decisions.

I’m disabled so I generally order everything online as it’s easier for me, but it appears I am going to have to venture out of my cave at some point.
history.review_full: It’s a beautiful color, but even though it had been packed extremely well imo it still arrived & showed considerable loss of ink due to shipping/handling disturbances.  It also left a stain on my bathroom vanity that I am still working on & thankfully it’s just a small one as I placed paper towels down before I opened the mess.  Next time I receive a bottle like this I’m just going to rinse it off, pat it dry, & slip a non-latex glove over it to keep everything in the vicinity safe including my hands bc the ink stained the label & wont come off except if my hands happen to be wet/moist.  The ink works well on both Tomoe River paper & cheap notebook paper & dries quickly.  As for the ink itself: I love it!  I don’t understand why it stained my vanity tho bc to my knowledge it’s not supposed to be waterproof.  Luckily after much scrubbing there is only a tiny mark left & I know it’s there, but I am really hoping my LL does not notice it.  Gonna try a little bleach on it next.  Also, I was able to mix a bit of it with a J Herbin red ink (scented red rose I believe) that I had on hand to get another shade of purple & I am quite pleased with it.  It is currently in a Dryden pen rn & it’s working beautifully with zero issues. This ink R&K is in a Lamy  “Candy” purple pen & is also working beautifully.  I wish they offered the inks in glass bottles instead of the cheap plastic.  Tho I recently received a bottle of Pilot Iroshiziku ink with a cracked lid & zero ink as it had obviously been upside down at some point during transit so glass is no guarantee that ink doesn’t get damaged. I’m disabled so I generally order everything online as it’s easier for me, but it appears I am going to have to venture out of my cave at some point. Lol. The ink is lovely if you can get one that has not been damaged or lost too much of it’s contents en route as I have.  I did notice that the cap on mine was dented & I believe that’s probably what allowed the ink to escape as they always tell us not to buy dented cans at grocery stores!  Things are only as good as their weakest links.
history.review_title: Ordering Ink online: never a good idea I guess.

product.title: Rohrer & Klingner Writing Ink - 50 ml Bottle - Helianthus (Sunflower Yellow)

history.review_excerpt: Bc I return garbage products & I don’t feel like I should be penalized when third party sellers & amazon send damaged/defective products & then expect me to be happy with them & keep them. Some work better if you write slow like a toddler, but I have never had to slow my hand with a zebra fountain pen nor any of the 200 others I own. I have tried them on cheap paper & expensive Tomoe River paper with the same results. I have hundreds of fountain pens, but I was looking for something that I could visually see at a moment’s glance what color was in the pen & I thought these would work. I will give them a few more days, but if the ink doesn’t settle in & lubricate the innards so that the writing experience is improved then I will definitely be sending these back bc they are garbage as-is.
history.review_full:
[[VIDEOID:63276c19932aa4f3687042b8b9f8613c]] Update: tried again to return them. I have prime. Amazon wants $7.99 to pick them up. Why? Bc I return garbage products & I don’t feel like I should be penalized when third party sellers & amazon send damaged/defective products & then expect me to be happy with them & keep them. Why should I bear the burden of a billion dollar plus corporation as a disabled veteran living on disability? These skip all over the place. The yellow won’t write no matter how much I shake the ball bearing. It and the black give a second of ink & stop. I even tried warming the ink up. The black finally became more viscous, but the yellow won’t lay down. If you have a fast hand & are used to taking fast notes these are useless. At least my set is. Garbage. Utter & complete garbage. Some work better if you write slow like a toddler, but I have never had to slow my hand with a zebra fountain pen nor any of the 200 others I own. And you don’t have to shake the zebra pen!

I purchased these bc of the reviews. Maybe I receive a bad batch. Idk. Mine are awful. I have fountain pens I purchased online for a dollar and less that works better & that write every single time I pick them up. Half of these did not even work after I attached the ink. I had to squeeze the cartridge repeatedly & even then I’m lucky if I get anything to come out. For $18 I was expecting to at least get something that would write every time I picked it up. These are a scratchy mess. I have tried them on cheap paper & expensive Tomoe River paper with the same results. I have hundreds of fountain pens, but I was looking for something that I could visually see at a moment’s glance what color was in the pen & I thought these would work. I will give them a few more days, but if the ink doesn’t settle in & lubricate the innards so that the writing experience is improved then I will definitely be sending these back bc they are garbage as-is.
history.review_title: I don’t get the reviews. Mine are garbage.

history.review_excerpt: Overall I’m pretty happy with this purchase bc the ink is good & I’ve purchased it before. The green is gorgeous. The purple didn’t really wow me, but it flows nicely. The blue however is a disappointment bc it’s extremely dry & keeps drying in my pen. I am using the inks in the same type of pen- platinum curidas & all have same size nib. So the only difference is the actual ink. I’m gonna try to mix a little of the ink with a tiny bit of glycerin next time I refill it & see if that helps it to stay wetter & not dry out in my pen. Aside from that I love their ink. Think I just received a dud this time with the blue.
history.review_full: Overall I’m pretty happy with this purchase bc the ink is good & I’ve purchased it before.  The green is gorgeous.  The purple didn’t really wow me, but it flows nicely. history.review_excerpt:
My first thought on opening the box was "wow, this is huge". Not that there is anything wrong with a rickshaw!

My new clipboard fits everything but the kitchen sink (see attached pic). I wear my stethoscope, but can store it in the clipboard when I leave work, so I don't forget it at home and then have to wear one of those plastic yellow isolation-cart throwaway ones that don't work for poop. I don't know how well it will hold up to my dropping it repeatedly, so I will post an update in a while with the durability factor.

P.S. I am one of those endlessly-researching people who look up reviews online for 7,456 items before deciding on one. :-)

**Update, December 2016: This case is still perfect!
history.review_full:
I was really excited to receive my new clipboard to replace my previous one which had started falling apart! My first thought on opening the box was "wow, this is huge". It's longer than my previous clipboard, so I wasn't sure how I would like toting it around at work (I'm an RN). However, the difference has been like trading up from a rickshaw to a Caddy. Not that there is anything wrong with a rickshaw!

My new clipboard fits everything but the kitchen sink (see attached pic). I wear my stethoscope, but can store it in the clipboard when I leave work, so I don't forget it at home and then have to wear one of those plastic yellow isolation-cart throwaway ones that don't work for poop. My pockets are usually BUSTING at the seams with all the stuff I like to carry around. No longer! I can cram it all inside this beast! I don't know how well it will hold up to my dropping it repeatedly, so I will post an update in a while with the durability factor.

P.S. I am one of those endlessly-researching people who look up reviews online for 7,456 items before deciding on one. You're welcome. I've done all the legwork for you. :-)

**Update, December 2016: This case is still perfect! No cracks, the top clip is still tightly secured, still feels really sturdy. :)

**Update, after dropping the case a few times over the years, a piece of the plastic broke. I'm buying a new one now. It lasted a really long time given the price!

history.review_excerpt: I highly recommend this for those with allergies. It bakes and makes pancakes very nicely. You just have to know what to add in to make it tasty. My default add-ins for any recipe tend to be vanilla extract, about 1/4 to 1/2 tsp sea salt (depending on recipe), baking soda, baking powder and Nutritious Yeast (adds buttery flavor to anything and a good oil like organic non-GMO canola or organic coconut oil (especially delicious for pancakes, donuts or any fried sweets). I usually mix this flour as half of what the recipe calls for with half of another alternative like tapioca (aka cassava), arrowroot flour or coconut flour.

I've tried heavier ned rig jig heads, as well as officially "weedless" ones. Neither works as well as the 1/15oz Reaction ones. The only downside to this product is the price. $2/hook? Not sure if this is an Amazon problem or a seller problem, but either way the price is too high. Would have re-bought these, but not at that price.

Bought this for my son, who is an avid kayaker and rafter, and spends his summers as a white water rafting guide: so he spends a great deal of time on the river and can be relied on for good advice when it comes to getting the right gear.

His verdict: this helmet is just plain uncomfortable to wear for several hours on the river. After a couple days, enough time to give this helmet a fair chance, he decided it just wasn't going to work for him.

It is possible that others may have diferent experience, but for gear that is really going to make the diference between an enjoyable day on the river, or not: invest in something better.
history.review_full:
Bought this for my son, who is an avid kayaker and rafter, and spends his summers as a white water rafting guide: so he spends a great deal of time on the river and can be relied on for good advice when it comes to getting the right gear.

His verdict: this helmet is just plain uncomfortable to wear for several hours on the river. The headband rubbed his skin and put uneven pressure on his head, giving him a headache over time. After a couple days, enough time to give this helmet a fair chance, he decided it just wasn't going to work for him.

It is possible that others may have diferent experience, but for gear that is really going to make the diference between an enjoyable day on the river, or not: invest in something better.

history.review_excerpt:
Purchased to sit on the wall as a decoration for our Western/Frontier motif bedroom.
Hanging on one wall is a authentic (handed down many generations) musket/long rifle. We didn't have a powder horn (it went to someone else many many years ago and is now lost). Another wall has Replica 1850-75 bow, arrows/quiver, bone knife (more plains look). So this powder horn looked a close enough mix for both.
Hung it above the nightstand. I need to age it yet and take oil to the strap to give it more patina.
tried to pull out the stops... not sure how this could be used in the field, many for enactors but not for real with rapid reloads needed.
history.review_full:
Purchased to sit on the wall as a decoration for our Western/Frontier motif bedroom.
Hanging on one wall is a authentic (handed down many generations) musket/long rifle. We didn't have a powder horn (it went to someone else many many years ago and is now lost). tried to pull out the stops... wow they were jammed in. not sure how this could be used in the field, many for enactors but not for real with rapid reloads needed.

heldout.review_excerpt:
I love that the female end of the quick connect seals closed when not connected to prevent spills, so you can disconnect it from the male end/the rest of the tube and no water will spill or leak.

They seal in very snugly, this is by design. You can disconnect and reconnect several times using this method.

I have been using Osprey Hydraulics and other Hydrapak products nearly every day over the past 5 years. They have a lifetime warranty, they are easy to clean (dishwasher or bottle bright tablets), they are filter compatible, and they LAST. I can't recommend these products enough and I use them for running, trail running, hiking, and backpacking in both summer and winter conditions.
heldout.review_full:
I ordered one of these a few years ago to replace a worn out connector on an osprey hydraulics bladder and I ordered a second kit recently to make reservoir adaptors for filling or in-line use with a sawyer squeeze (using the blue and grey sawyer 28mm to in line adaptors that came with the squeeze filter). The same adaptors can use used to convert any 28mm soft bottle into a reservoir or refill a reservoir from any 28mm bottle. How fantastic! I love that the female end of the quick connect seals closed when not connected to prevent spills, so you can disconnect it from the male end/the rest of the tube and no water will spill or leak.

They seal in very snugly, this is by design. However, you can pull the adaptor out of the house easily after running under warm water. I saw in another review that someone got frustrated because they inserted the adaptor into the wrong length tube and threw out the entire bladder - wow! No need to do that, run it under warm water and pull it out. I think this represents a massive user error and is in no way the fault of the manufacture. You can disconnect and reconnect several times using this method.

I have been using Osprey Hydraulics and other Hydrapak products nearly every day over the past 5 years. Other than replacing one worn out part (for $10) I have had no problems at all. They have a lifetime warranty, they are easy to clean (dishwasher or bottle bright tablets), they are filter compatible, and they LAST. I can't recommend these products enough and I use them for running, trail running, hiking, and backpacking in both summer and winter conditions.

history.review_excerpt:
I weighed about 250 when I got this saddle, now about 233. The saddle was great. I love flat saddles and this is one but then after a month of use, the middle started to sag, so it then felt like a saddle with a swoop. This then gave me pressure sores. I have actual notice this issue with the middle sinking down with most Terry saddles. I think they are made for ladies who weigh less.

Even when not on the saddle now, you can just put your hands on the middle and it just sinks down, like it is just cloth on plastic.

So this saddle is great if you weigh less than I did.
history.review_full:
I weighed about 250 when I got this saddle, now about 233. The saddle was great. I have actual notice this issue with the middle sinking down with most Terry saddles. I think they are made for ladies who weigh less.

Even when not on the saddle now, you can just put your hands on the middle and it just sinks down, like it is just cloth on plastic.

So this saddle is great if you weigh less than I did.
